titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sylvester Winkler papers 1977.560
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-07 21:38:50 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection spans 1854 to 1870 and consists of a mortgage for Sylvester Winkler's bakery on Pacific Street in Brooklyn and various receipts and licenses for Winkler's business.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Sylvester Winkler operated a bakery at 752 Pacific Street at the corner of Vanderbilt Avenue in Brooklyn. His residence was above his place of business.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Sylvester Winkler papers, 1977.560, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection spans 1854 to 1870 and consists of a mortgage for Sylvester Winkler's bakery on Pacific Street in Brooklyn, and various business and tax receipts and licenses for Winkler's business.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
